body.name: SilverStone Technology RM44 4U Rackmount Server Chassis with Enhanced Liquid Cooling Capability (up to 360mm Radiator), SST-RM44
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 3 hrs 8 mins
features: Supports up to 360mm liquid cooling radiators
Supports up to SSI-EEB / Extended ATX motherboards
Includes sliding rail mounting holes for quick rail installation
Front panel features anti-theft lock design providing additional security
body.description: In 2019, SilverStone released a complete high-end server chassis which served as a dual-purpose chassis for industrial rackmount or high-end home system usage – the RM42-502, main feature being support up to 240mm liquid cooling radiators which was rare to see in server chassis’ at the time. Fast forward to 2022, SilverStone is releasing a new server chassis as an enhanced version of the RM42-502 – RM4, with better cooling, greater storage options and most importantly, greater clearance for today’s high-end graphics card. The RM44 is designed for space optimization which supports up to 360mm radiators, motherboard up to SSI-EEB and graphics cards lengths of up to 424mm. There is an expansion card retainer in both the RM42-502 and RM44 but in the RM44, there are added mounting holes for an additional 3 x 2.5" or 2 x 3.5" drives; a tremendous and highly functional addition to an industrial rackmount chassis, making this 4U rackmount chassis unparalleled in compactness and space utilization.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.8 4.8 out of 5 stars 16 ratings 4.8 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Really well-made case with solid materials and zero defects. The lockable front door is a nice touch, even if it's left unlocked, because it prevents accidental power or reset button presses.The inclusion of 2 network activity lights on the front panel is a nice touch, but I have yet to configure a motherboard that includes pinouts for network activity. (A shame.)Although the case is touted as being perfect for large radiators, and even though they are correct that radiators will fit well, I wouldn't recommend it. That's because putting a radiator on the front of the case forces you to suck hot air into the case (through the radiator), because in a rack you would never blow hot air into the front of the rack. You always want air to flow front to back. So forget the liquid cooling and put three 120mm fans inside, across the front of the case.A Noctua NH-D9L CPU cooler fits nicely, but then again YMMV because if you install any 3.5" hard drives you need to be careful about cooler height. (I only use m.2 SSDs these days, so it is not an issue for me.)Silverstone generally makes quality products, and this case is no exception.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: i was bale to fit 4070 with AIO and everything fit perfectly came with 2 pre-installed exhaust fans

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Case for Rack Mount Gaming PC But Beware
reviews.reviewText: This case has been great to work with. Super easy. A ton of space. Was easier to install my 360 mm AIO than in a regular case.However, if you are going to buy this please be careful of GPU height and length. I bought an ASUS TUF RTX 4090 but I had only a few mm of clearance above the card. I thought I couldn't plug in a cable and close the lid. after some careful smushing down of the 12VHPWR cable, the GPU actually does fit in the case.If your GPU height is any taller than the ASUS TUF RTX 4090/4080 it will NOT fit in this chassis. Please make sure your power cable is plugged in securely after bending it and you should not have a problem!I honestly think the RTX 4090/4080 FE is the ONLY version of the 4090/4080 that will fit in the case comfortably. If you pick up CableMod's 180 degree adapter, you should have a much easier time fitting in the larger 4000 series cards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Silverstone hits a homerun.
reviews.reviewText: Initially i used the SST-RM23-502 the 2U server chassis, and ran into cooling issues, so I switched to this one. It's a higher on the price end but I wasn't disappointed at all. allows plenty of room for versatile cooling capabilities, space and support for large GPU's and provides plenty of room for several hard drives.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Love this case, currently using it stand alone until my rack arrives. Using with EATX threadripper build with 360 AIO, 6 nvme drives and an older Radeon GPU as my ProMox server.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A little on the expensive side, but great quality.
reviews.reviewText: You are essentially paying 3x what you would pay for a similar workstation case for the privilege of being able to rack mount the system (and that doesn't even include the cost of rails). If being able to rackmount a case that has support for liquid cooling is important to you, the case is very good quality and was easy to build in. It can be used up-right using the included legs, but if you are not rackmounting, you can get much better value from a workstation case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My server to be is also my gaming rig.Asus 79013900kAsus rog 4080.It's handling it all very well

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great for a gaming computer/server.
reviews.reviewText: Was able to fit an RTX 4090 in it with liquid cooling, but the graphics card has to be mounted horizontally relative to the case. The top of the case cannot close with it mounted straight up.
